Description: Mould-made amuletic figure in glazed composition, representing a reclining figure; one leg only preserved; according to better preserved example possibly Egyptian god Harpokrates (?); thick turquoise glaze; very fragmentary.
Curator's comments: Found unregistered, but with other objects from Naukratis with labels from the EEF from Petrie's excavations at Naukratis in 1885.

Two labels that were found in the box indicated finds from the Temple of Apollo in Naukratis, VIth cent. B.C. They concerned a "glazed-sand figure" and a "glazed-sand head". This glazed composition figure however is later in date. As a possible parallel from Naukratis, see the recling ithyphallic figure of Harpokrates BM 1886,0401.1495.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (OK.104) (phase 3)
